result.execSummary:
The defendant Heather L Streff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court
Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 19 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid as follows:  $464.75 payable to Menards and $216.65 payable to Walmart.  Restitution is to be paid as a Condition of Probation BEFORE costs/fines.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  DNA sample and surcharge are waived.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
No contact with the Menards or Walmart listed in the Criminal Complaint.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 19 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Concurrent with: Count 1.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Same Conditions for Probation apply as to Count 1.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Read In List filed by the District Attorney's office

David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Heather L Streff in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to counts 1 & 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of counts 1 & 2.



Court orders the following:
Count 1:
150 Days in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
19  Days Credit.
STAYED.

Term of Probation:  1 Year.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Mendards or WalMart listed in the complaint.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).


RESTITUTION:  $681.40 (Breakdown:  $464.75 to Mendards & $216.65 to WalMart - restitution to be paid before costs or fines);

Costs:  $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.







Count 2:
150 Days in the Waukesha County Jail.
19  Days Credit.
Concurrent to count 1.
STAYED.

Term of Probation: 1 year
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
Same as count 1.


Costs:  $243
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Heather L Streff in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   
File not called on the record.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.
filed by defendant requesting a bail reduction hearing.

Order Denying - Defense Motion for Bail Modification.
Signed by Judge Lee S. Dreyfus, Jr., on 12/11/15.

Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Heather L Streff in court, in custody, with attorney Adam J. Schleis.   

Atty. Schleis presented arguments for bail modification to the court.
Defense requesting a Surety Bond to be co-signed by her mother in-law.
State objects to any bail modification.
Defendant has a new referral pending.

Court Denies - Defense request for Bail Modification.
Court signed order.
All parties received a copy of the order in court.



  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Jail Inmate Communication Form filed by defendant requesting bail modification for family situation.
Motion to Modify Bail filed by Attorney Schleis.
filed by defendant requesting a bail modification.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with any Menard's stores.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.

Defendant Heather L Streff in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Adam Schleis appears as friend of the court.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.
